result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:00 pm - DA calls cases 15CF45, 15CF46, 15CF47, 15CF51, 15CF56, 15CF57, 16CF42, and 16CF43 and states appearances.  Defendant Paul J. Schleis in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The motion is to stay the balance of DE's jail pending appeal.  Argument by Atty Morgan.  Clarification sought by Court.  Comments by DA regarding motion to withdraw plea.  Further comment by Court re: motion to withdraw plea.  Court denys motion to stay as premature.
Clerks note:  Notice of Intent to Pursue Postconviction Relief, Judgment, and Court Record Card mailed to SPD
extending time for filing a notice of intent to seek postconviction relief
in Support of Defendant's Motion for Stay Pending Post-Conviction Relief

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
1:15 pm - DA calls cases 15CF45, 15CF46, 15CF47, 15CF51, 15CF56, 15CF57, 16CF42, 16CF43 and 16CF46, states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Paul J. Schleis in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The DA moves to amend 15CF56 from Felony to Misd. bail jumping.  So ordered.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Ct 2 on 15CF45, Ct 3 on 15CF46, and amended 15CF56.   Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire form.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct 2 on 15CF45, Ct 3 on 15CF46, and amended 15CF56.  DE admits to 15CF47, 16CF42, 16CF43, along with uncharged PPD 15-895, and PRSO16-1240 for purposes of restitution and service fees.  DA certifies victims rights compliance. DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO. On motion of state, court dismisses Ct 1 on 15CF45, Cts 1 &2 on 15CF46, 15CF51, both counts in 15CF57.

Court imposes:
15CF45 Ct 2 - Sentence withheld - 3 years probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine, $250 DNAAS, 6 months jail with huber (cs) with 1 day credit for time served, psycho-sexual assessment, followthrough and treatment, apology to victim in a way and manner to be determined by probation officer, AODA and followthrough with any recommendation.  Separately from probation, Sex offender registry is ordered DE's lifetime.

15CF46 Ct 3 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 court costs, $200 DNAAS, $25 restitution + $2.50 surcharge for a total of $27.50, 30 days jail with huber (cs), with credit for 1 day served.  AODA and followthrough with any recommendation

Amended 15CF56 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine, $200 DNAAS, $65 SBDA, 30 days jail with huber (cs), AODA and followthrough with any recommendation, apology to victim in a way and manner to be determined by probation officer, along with costs on Dismissed but read in costs on 15CF47 - $45 SBDA, 16CF42 - $65 SBDA, 16CF43 $115.50 blood draw fee to PPD.

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 28, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

16CF42 and 16CF43.  Defendant Paul J. Schleis appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
State's - & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE shall not consume any alcohol.

(ph) 1:50 pm - Defendant Paul J. Schleis appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 8/30/16 at 10 am.  Court gives DE a notice of right to attorney and victim witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
